meanings.sent1: She was known for her antitechnological views, preferring books over computers.
meanings.sent2: The small village had an antitechnological vibe, with no smartphones in sight.
meanings.sent3: The antitechnological cat refused to play with the robotic mouse toy.
meanings.sent4: His antitechnological mindset was a barrier to embracing modern conveniences.
meanings.sent5: The antitechnological protest aimed to raise awareness about the dangers of excessive technology use.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a lack of technological advancements.
meanings.sent1: The antitechnological society still used old-fashioned tools for farming.
meanings.sent2: Their antitechnological infrastructure struggled to keep up with the neighboring cities.
meanings.sent3: The antitechnological museum displayed ancient artifacts with no digital enhancements.
meanings.sent4: The antitechnological town seemed frozen in time, untouched by progress.
meanings.sent5: Living in an antitechnological world felt like stepping back into history.

meanings.definition: Resistant to the use of technology.
meanings.sent1: Grandma's antitechnological nature meant she preferred handwritten letters to emails.
meanings.sent2: The antitechnological group protested against the implementation of new software.
meanings.sent3: The antitechnological toddler threw a tantrum when handed a tablet.
meanings.sent4: His antitechnological tendencies made it challenging for him to adapt to the digital age.
meanings.sent5: The antitechnological activist urged people to disconnect from screens and reconnect with nature.
